snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s administration has set aside a campaign pledge to spur manufacturing in favor of a much broader and more ambitious plan favored by an influential hotel union....
abstract: Proposal requiring City Council approval for new hotels in certain industrial areas of New York City is quietly put forth by Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration; effort is backed by powerful union New York Hotel and Motel Trades Council, as new rules would likely force developers of such projects to adhere to union labor requirements; union has close ties with de Blasio, who is actively courting labor endorsements ahead of 2017 election.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s administration has set aside a campaign pledge to spur manufacturing in favor of a much broader and more ambitious plan favored by an influential hotel union.

headline.main: Unlikely Ally and Quiet Shift in de Blasio Plan to Protect Industrial Jobs
headline.print_headline: Quiet Shift, and Unlikely Ally, for a de Blasio Plan to Protect Industrial Jobs

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York Hotel and Motel Trades Council
